WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi Shawn,

As explained on this thread on Microsoft Connect (http://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/530074/unhandled-error-in-silverlight-application-2105-when-building-as-an-x86-configuration), this is a limitation of Silverlight, which "(...) only supports assemblies that are built AnyCpu (MSIL)."

You might find the workarounds proposed in the aforementioned link useful. Since this is not a Prism Issue, I'm closing it. You might continue your inquires in the Silverlight forums (http://forums.silverlight.net/forums/).

Thank you for your feedback.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
WorkItem.Description:
I just downloaded Prism 2.2, and built the Prism Assemblies in a Release Build for x86 (as opposed to a Debug build for AnyCPU)
Then started a new Silverlight Application using VS 2010.
Without making any changes I just run the app, to make sure all is well.
Then I add references to the Silverlight Prism assemblies.
Then I F5 run the app again.  This time I get a Webpage Error dialog from Internet Explorer saying:
Line: 56
Error: Unhandled Error in Silverlight Application 
Code: 2105    
Category: InitializeError       
Message: Failed to load pre-requisites for the application     
Â 
What gives?  Any idea what I need to do to resolve this?
Thanks,
Shawn.
PS, When I build the assemblies using the default Debug Build for AnyCPU, and reference these assemblies in my Silverlight app all is well.
WorkItem.Summary: Failed to load pre-requisites for the application
